intro: Scleropus, commonly known as the rock fig, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Moraceae. It is characterized by its woody stems and dense, often thorny foliage. The leaves are typically opposite and ovate, with a rough texture. The plant produces small, clustered fruits that are edible and have a fig-like appearance. Scleropus thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and coastal regions.
